senses.sense_definition: To install software or data on a computer or electronic device before it is sold or distributed to the user.

examples.text: The manufacturer decided to <w>preload</w> the new smartphones with several popular games.
My laptop came <w>preloaded</w> with essential security software so I could use it immediately.

senses.sense_definition: To drink alcohol at home or in a private setting before going out to a social venue, typically to save money.

examples.text: Since drinks at the club are expensive, we decided to <w>preload</w> at my apartment first.
They usually <w>preload</w> with beer and wine before heading downtown for the night.

senses.sense_definition: The stretching of the heart muscle fibers at the end of the resting phase (diastole) just before contraction.

examples.text: Doctors monitor the patient's cardiac <w>preload</w> to ensure the heart is pumping efficiently.
An increase in blood volume can significantly raise the <w>preload</w> on the ventricles.

senses.sense_definition: A constant internal force or stress applied to a mechanical component, such as a bearing or bolt, to ensure stability and prevent looseness.

examples.text: You must adjust the <w>preload</w> on the bearings to prevent the wheel from wobbling.
The mechanic checked the bolt's <w>preload</w> to ensure the assembly remained tight under vibration.
